definition: cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
green headband (to visit a Yuan dynasty brothel)/cuckold
lit. to wear green headband (to visit a Yuan dynasty brothel)/cuckold

sentences.english: Wander through awned streets. Turbaned faces going by.
sentences.chinese: 一张张缠了穆斯林头巾的脸走了过去。

sentences.english: Many neighborhoods in France are no-go areas for women without head scarves.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，许多街道都不准许没有戴头巾的妇女进入。

sentences.english: I have been wearing the hijab for 20 years and it has never hindered me.
sentences.chinese: 我已经戴头巾戴了二十年，这从未妨碍我。

sentences.english: They didn't have burkas, and they immediately came up and talked to me.
sentences.chinese: 她们没有戴头巾，并且立即就站起来和我交谈。

sentences.english: Here, I'll even give you one of our red bandanas.
sentences.chinese: 来，我要给你代表我们帮派的红头巾。

sentences.english: I untied the turban from the bird's foot.
sentences.chinese: 于是便把头巾从大鹏鸟的脚上解了下来。

sentences.english: I uncover the red kerchief on your head.
I couldn't gauge his expression because his face was completely obscured by his turban.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸完全被头巾遮盖，因此我猜不出他的表情。

sentences.english: As I rewrapped my scarf, however, I heard a chorus of hisses.
sentences.chinese: 在我重新包裹头巾的时候，听到了一阵嘘声。
难道你不喜欢我的头巾吗？

sentences.english: Why do you wear a turban today?
sentences.chinese: 你今天为什么戴头巾呢？

sentences.english: He thinks he's bad-ass because he wears a bandana .
sentences.chinese: 他觉得他头上戴了条印花头巾就是个痞子样了。

sentences.english: She dashes out but forgets her hijab.
sentences.chinese: 她冲了出来，却忘了她的头巾。

sentences.english: She adjusted her coloured head scarf fussily…
sentences.chinese: 她不厌其烦地调弄着自己的彩色头巾。

sentences.english: Women in bright headscarves queue for bags of dried lavender.
sentences.chinese: 戴着明亮头巾的妇女们排队购买成袋的干薰衣草。

sentences.english: Me gusta el pauelo de color.

definition: Chinese-style long robe worn as outermost garment/burqa
cape/shawl/(of long hair) to trail over one's shoulders
Chinese skullcap resembling the skin of half a watermelon
hair worn in a bun or coil
